oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Henry Shipherd correspondence with Raymond B. Witt, 1956 February 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Shipherd, Henry
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from associate director of the Highland Folk School in Monteagle, Tennessee to Raymond B. Witt, chairman of the Board of Educaiton in Chattanooga, Tennessee. The letter informs Witt of workshops on upcoming workshops on public school integration being held in Nashville, Tennessee.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education correspondence and memoranda, 1955-1957
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1953-1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
